metadata.Title: CVE-2017-11720 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
There is a division-by-zero vulnerability in LAME 3.99.5, caused by a malformed input file. It was discovered that LAME incorrectly handled certain audio files. An attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a denial of service or possibly other unspecified impact.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-11720` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

lame - 3.99.5+repack1-9build1
libmp3lame0 - 3.99.5+repack1-9build1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: lame package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.99.5+repack1-9build1').
